Registry of Open Data on AWS

Usage examples for all datasets listed in the Registry of Open Data on AWS tagged with earthquakes.

Low Altitude Disaster Imagery (LADI) Dataset

Tutorials
  • LADI Tutorials by Andrew Weinert, Jianyu Mao, Kiana Harris, Nae-Rong Chang, Caleb Pennell, Yiming Ren, Ryan Earley, Nadia Dimitrova
Tools & Applications
  • NIST TRECVID 2020 - Disaster Scene Description and Indexing (DSDI) by TREC Video Retrieval Evaluation (TRECVID)
  • Remote Sensing for Disaster Response Course by Beaver Works Summer Institute
Publications
  • Large Scale Organization and Inference of an Imagery Dataset for Public Safety by Jeffrey Liu, David Strohschein, Siddharth Samsi, Andrew Weinert
  • Train and Deploy an Image Classifier for Disaster Response by Jianyu Mao, Kiana Harris, Nae-Rong Chang, Caleb Pennell, Yiming Ren
  • Video Testing at the FirstNet Innovation and Test Lab Using a Public Safety Dataset by Chris Budny, Jeffrey Liu, Andrew Weinert

Southern California Earthquake Data

Tutorials
  • Cactus to Clouds: Processing The SCEDC Open Data Set on AWS by Tim Clements
  • Getting Started with SCEDC AWS Public Dataset by Ellen Yu
  • Script to Download Seismic Waveforms from the SCEDC AWS Public Dataset by Aparna Bhaskaran
  • SeisNoise.jl GPU Computing Tutorial - Another example of accessing data s3://scedc-pds for ambient noise cross-correlation by Tim Clements
  • Using Lambda to Process Seismograms by Shang-Lin Chen

OpenEEW

Tutorials
  • Analyzing a magnitude 7.2 earthquake in Mexico using Python by Grillo
  • Developing a machine learning model for better earthquake detection by Grillo
Tools & Applications
  • OpenEEW library for Python by Grillo

If you want to add a dataset or usage example to this registry, please follow the instructions on the Registry of Open Data on AWS GitHub repository.
